title.narrative: 5.1 GOVERNANCE AND SYSTEMS

description.narrative: This Intermediate Results (IR) will cover governance structures and systems that are necessary to adequately manage risks and achieve programme results. These governan ce structures and systems will be described in detail in the Annual Mana gement Plan. Activities and associated costs corresponding to the Bienni al Support Budget functions at country level covered under Functions 2, 4, 8 and 11, including the salaries and related non-staff costs of Repre sentative, Deputy Representative, Chief of Operations, Information/ Comm unications staff, Information Technology, business continuity and risk m anagement, will be included under this result, which contributes to Field Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Field/Country Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Effective and efficient programme management and Operations support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: This IR will cover governance structures and systems that are necessary to adequately manage risks and achieve programme results.These governan ce structures and systems will be described in detail in the Annual Mana gement Plan. Activities and associatedcosts corresponding to the Bienni al Support Budget functions at country level covered under Functions 2, 4, 8 and 11, includingthe salaries and related non-staff costs of Repre sentative, Deputy Representative, Chief of Operations, Information/ Communications staff, Information Technology, business continuity and risk m anagement, will be included under this result

description.narrative: The CMT played a key role in providing support to the Representative in planning and decision-making processes. All staff meetings and programme team meetings were held weekly with the aim to ensure an efficient flow of information and strong coordination within the office. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/01/2019

title.narrative: At least three workshop with partners in Operation manuals organised
Mapping of roles and SOPS updated and approved by CMT

Performance of SAP/VISION in the office is strengthened, by: a) identify source/nature of most frequent errors, b) take required actions to avoid such errors, c) review and modify as necessary SOPs of affected procedures and train users to utilize them, d) solve all cases under service calls.
100% of DCT more than 9 months which are on the service calls in VISION resolved

baseline.value: 38 per cent DCTs outstanding for > 9 months, equivalent to US$224,000 are on service calls

title.narrative: Effective and efficient communications tools between the office in Managua and the sub-office in Bilwi are available and used, by the means of the implementation of a plan for quarterly visits to Bilwi and the development of a system for virtual meetings.

target.value: 2017:90% of the office meetings include Bilwi through viartual means.

title.narrative: Improve efficiency of ICT-provided solutions by: a) implementing a platform of remote access and support for users, b) implementing a backups plan for users and servers, c) improving and strengthening the radio-communications system, and d) completing the plan for replacement of obsolete equipment.
